page.title: 17RELIGION IN FRILSHAM
page.content: The beautiful Saxon Church at Frilsham is dedicated to St Frideswide. It was built in 1150 on the site of a Roman temple. Its circular graveyard is associated with heathen worship. The chancel was added in the 15th century. Frilsham is part of the{Hermitage team {of churches,}five villages under the care of three clergy. A dwindling number of clergy has meant more lay participation in church services. The Alternative Service Book of 1982 is used.{The numbers attending are good. There is a choir. St Frideswide was famed for healing the blind. Inspired by her a ministry of healing has been established at Frilsham using water from a well blessed by the Saint, healing mind and body. St Mary's Church at Marlston uses the Book of Common Prayer.{R/Catholics}go to Douai Abbey and{Nonconformists}to Bucklebury
